verses.verse: “Egypt is a very pretty (Hos. 10:11) heifer, But destruction comes, it comes (Jer. 1:14) from the north.

Also her mercenaries are in her midst like fat bulls, For they also are turned back, They have fled away together. They did not stand, For ((Ps. 37:13); Jer. 50:27) the day of their calamity had come upon them, The time of their punishment.
((Is. 29:4)) Her noise shall go like a serpent, For they shall march with an army And come against her with axes, Like those who chop wood.
“They shall (Is. 10:34) cut down her forest,” says the LORD, “Though it cannot be searched, Because they are innumerable, And more numerous than (Judg. 6:5; 7:12; Joel 2:25) grasshoppers.
The daughter of Egypt shall be ashamed; She shall be delivered into the hand Of (Jer. 1:15) the people of the north.”

The LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says: “Behold, I will bring punishment on Amon of (Ezek. 30:14-16; Nah. 3:8) No, and Pharaoh and Egypt, (Ex. 12:12; Jer. 43:12, 13; Ezek. 30:13; Zeph. 2:11) with their gods and their kings—Pharaoh and those who (Is. 30:1-5; 31:1-3) trust in him.

(Jer. 44:30; Ezek. 32:11) And I will deliver them into the hand of those who seek their lives, into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and the hand of his servants. (Ezek. 29:8-14) Afterward it shall be inhabited as in the days of old,” says the LORD.
